content: I suppose I'm going to catch some flack over this but I have my Kevlar and dug a foxhole in my back yard. I spent eight years listening to President Bush Jr. denigrated. Before that it was President Regan and before that it Was president Bush Sr and before that President Clinton.(I think I have that order right but if it isn't it's not germane to what I want to say. Now Barack Obama is our president and there is a steady stream of denigration directed at him. I understand that feelings run high and this is a sensitive topic. There is nothing wrong with disliking the man that is our president and CinC. There is nothing wrong with expressing ones opinions. What bothers me is that the some posters are making broad statements that defile the office of president and CinC. All I'd ask is posters respect the office if not the man. I've been posting here for a while now. No one has seen me disrespect any of our leaders. I like some of them and dislike some of them but I respectfully refer to them by their titles. You will also notice that I refer to both Republicans and Democrate with the same respect. INCOMING, HIT THE DECK!! This message has been edited. COMMENT: On this site, there are those who cannot -- or simply refuse -- to separate the "personal" from the substantive issues. To many of those, as all politics was "local" to Tip O'Neill, they regard all politics as "personal" and somewhat of a blood sport on here. It's why some posters will vigorously defend someone like Sarah Palin against all objective criticism based on her credentials and statements and initiate personal attacks against posters who do. This simply creates a constant state of agitation in which legitimate debate and discussion cannot take place, and it all devolves into a series of personal remarks. Your stance has been offered here several times previously, but there are some who simply make every political observation the subject of a personal vendetta or verbal attack against another poster. Vigorous debate is acceptable; the constant personal hectoring is not. One only needs to look at some of the extreme threads here that are merely a thin veneer for a personal attack against this particular president, i.e., the absurd notion about Mr. Obama's use of a teleprompter, the continued regurgitation about Obama's birth certificate and citizenship, ad nauseum.

content: You won't find much respect here from those on the left, right, or middle. There are good debates and conversations, but many of the posters will say anything and everything about the President. There are people that were very disrespectful of the last President. It has gotten worse since President Obama was sworn in though. It is hard to believe that many of the people on here insulting and name calling the President have served or they are serving in the military. There are good people here, but most only throw out catchy words like Obamanation. There is also a rampant conspiracy group that refuses to believe the President is a citizen. There is no respect for the office in the media either, and I think that yellow journalism has made people forget that the office of the President is one to be respected. The left wing media portrayed President Bush as a chimp (don't try that with Obama). The right wing smears Obama just as bad though. Most people can't debate the issues, they get their opinions given to them by Rush or MSNBC. It is no surprise when the only argument someone has in Bush is bad, or Obama is the anti-christ.

reply: COMMENT: On this site, there are those who cannot -- or simply refuse -- to separate the "personal" from the substantive issues. To many of those, as all politics was "local" to Tip O'Neill, they regard all politics as "personal" and somewhat of a blood sport on here. It's why some posters will vigorously defend someone like Sarah Palin against all objective criticism based on her credentials and statements and initiate personal attacks against posters who do. This simply creates a constant state of agitation in which legitimate debate and discussion cannot take place, and it all devolves into a series of personal remarks. Your stance has been offered here several times previously, but there are some who simply make every political observation the subject of a personal vendetta or verbal attack against another poster. Vigorous debate is acceptable; the constant personal hectoring is not. One only needs to look at some of the extreme threads here that are merely a thin veneer for a personal attack against this particular president, i.e., the absurd notion about Mr. Obama's use of a teleprompter, the continued regurgitation about Obama's birth certificate and citizenship, ad nauseum.
title: How About a Little Respect?

content: You won't find much respect here from those on the left, right, or middle. There are good debates and conversations, but many of the posters will say anything and everything about the President. There are people that were very disrespectful of the last President. It has gotten worse since President Obama was sworn in though. It is hard to believe that many of the people on here insulting and name calling the President have served or they are serving in the military. There are good people here, but most only throw out catchy words like Obamanation. There is also a rampant conspiracy group that refuses to believe the President is a citizen. There is no respect for the office in the media either, and I think that yellow journalism has made people forget that the office of the President is one to be respected. The left wing media portrayed President Bush as a chimp (don't try that with Obama). The right wing smears Obama just as bad though. Most people can't debate the issues, they get their opinions given to them by Rush or MSNBC. It is no surprise when the only argument someone has in Bush is bad, or Obama is the anti-christ.

content: I suppose I'm going to catch some flack over this but I have my Kevlar and dug a foxhole in my back yard. I spent eight years listening to President Bush Jr. denigrated. Before that it was President Regan and before that it Was president Bush Sr and before that President Clinton.(I think I have that order right but if it isn't it's not germane to what I want to say. Now Barack Obama is our president and there is a steady stream of denigration directed at him. I understand that feelings run high and this is a sensitive topic. There is nothing wrong with disliking the man that is our president and CinC. There is nothing wrong with expressing ones opinions. What bothers me is that the some posters are making broad statements that defile the office of president and CinC. All I'd ask is posters respect the office if not the man. I've been posting here for a while now. No one has seen me disrespect any of our leaders. I like some of them and dislike some of them but I respectfully refer to them by their titles. You will also notice that I refer to both Republicans and Democrate with the same respect. INCOMING, HIT THE DECK!! This message has been edited. COMMENT: On this site, there are those who cannot -- or simply refuse -- to separate the "personal" from the substantive issues. To many of those, as all politics was "local" to Tip O'Neill, they regard all politics as "personal" and somewhat of a blood sport on here. It's why some posters will vigorously defend someone like Sarah Palin against all objective criticism based on her credentials and statements and initiate personal attacks against posters who do. This simply creates a constant state of agitation in which legitimate debate and discussion cannot take place, and it all devolves into a series of personal remarks. Your stance has been offered here several times previously, but there are some who simply make every political observation the subject of a personal vendetta or verbal attack against another poster. Vigorous debate is acceptable; the constant personal hectoring is not. One only needs to look at some of the extreme threads here that are merely a thin veneer for a personal attack against this particular president, i.e., the absurd notion about Mr. Obama's use of a teleprompter, the continued regurgitation about Obama's birth certificate and citizenship, ad nauseum.

content: You won't find much respect here from those on the left, right, or middle. There are good debates and conversations, but many of the posters will say anything and everything about the President. There are people that were very disrespectful of the last President. It has gotten worse since President Obama was sworn in though. It is hard to believe that many of the people on here insulting and name calling the President have served or they are serving in the military. There are good people here, but most only throw out catchy words like Obamanation. There is also a rampant conspiracy group that refuses to believe the President is a citizen. There is no respect for the office in the media either, and I think that yellow journalism has made people forget that the office of the President is one to be respected. The left wing media portrayed President Bush as a chimp (don't try that with Obama). The right wing smears Obama just as bad though. Most people can't debate the issues, they get their opinions given to them by Rush or MSNBC. It is no surprise when the only argument someone has in Bush is bad, or Obama is the anti-christ.
